title: How to Keep Fruit from Turning Brown

steps.title: Place your sliced fruit into a medium-sized bowl.
steps.content: Place your sliced fruit into a medium-sized bowl. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Mix together 1 tbs.
steps.content: Mix together 1 tbs. (30 g) of honey and 1 cup (128 g) of slightly warm water. Honey will dissolve easier in warm water than it will in cold water. [2] X Research source If you are slicing multiple pieces of fruit, be sure to double or triple the honey and water amounts as needed so the fruit can be completely soaked in the mixture.

steps.title: Pour the honey and water mixture over the fruit.
steps.content: Pour the honey and water mixture over the fruit. Make sure that all fruit slices are completely covered with the honey and water mixture.

steps.title: Allow the fruit slices to soak in the honey and water mixture for 30 seconds.
steps.content: Allow the fruit slices to soak in the honey and water mixture for 30 seconds. [3] X Research source

steps.title: Drain the honey and water mixture from the bowl of fruit, or remove the fruit from the bowl.
steps.content: Drain the honey and water mixture from the bowl of fruit, or remove the fruit from the bowl. Your fruit slices will now appear bright and fresh-looking for up to 8 hours. [4] X Research source

steps.title: Place your fruit slices into a medium-sized bowl.
steps.content: Place your fruit slices into a medium-sized bowl.

steps.title: Mix together 1 tbs.
steps.content: Mix together 1 tbs. (15 g) of lemon juice and 1 cup (128 g) of water. [5] X Research source If you are preparing multiple slices of fruit, double or triple the lemon juice and water amounts as needed so all fruit slices can be completely submerged in the mixture.

steps.title: Pour the lemon juice and water mixture over the fruit.
steps.content: Pour the lemon juice and water mixture over the fruit. [6] X Research source Make sure that all the fruit slices are completely covered with the lemon juice and water mixture.

steps.title: Allow the fruit to soak for a total of 5 minutes.
steps.content: Allow the fruit to soak for a total of 5 minutes. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Drain the lemon juice and water mixture from the bowl of fruit, or transfer the fruit to another container.
steps.content: Drain the lemon juice and water mixture from the bowl of fruit, or transfer the fruit to another container. Your fruit slices will now appear fresh for up to several hours.

steps.title: Place your fruit slices into a large bowl.
steps.content: Place your fruit slices into a large bowl.

steps.title: Dissolve 1/2 tsp.
steps.content: Dissolve 1/2 tsp. (2.46 g) of salt into 4 cups (512 g) of water. [8] X Research source If you want to keep your fruit snack as healthy as possible, use sea salt instead of table salt. Sea salt is minimally-processed compared to table salt, which is often heavily bleached and processed.

steps.title: Pour the salt and water mixture over the fruit.
steps.content: Pour the salt and water mixture over the fruit. [9] X Research source Make sure that all the fruit slices are completely covered with the salt and water mixture.

steps.title: Allow the fruit to soak for 5 minutes.
steps.content: Allow the fruit to soak for 5 minutes. [10] X Research source

steps.title: Drain the salt and water mixture from the bowl of fruit, or move the fruit to a separate container.
steps.content: Drain the salt and water mixture from the bowl of fruit, or move the fruit to a separate container. Your fruit slices will now appear fresh for up to several hours. [11] X Research source
